name: tailwindcss-class-sorter
description: Sort Tailwind CSS classes in any file format using configurable regex patterns. Works with Ruby/Phlex, ERB, React, Vue, and more.

commands.title: Tailwind CSS: Sort Classes in Document
Tailwind CSS: Sort Classes in Selection

tailwindcss-sorter.enable.description: Enable/disable the Tailwind CSS class sorter extension.

tailwindcss-sorter.tailwindConfigPath.description: Path to the Tailwind CSS config file (relative to workspace root). Leave empty for auto-detection.

tailwindcss-sorter.tailwindStylesheetPat.description: Path to the Tailwind CSS v4 stylesheet (relative to workspace root). Leave empty for auto-detection.

tailwindcss-sorter.preserveWhitespace.description: Preserve whitespace around classes when sorting.

tailwindcss-sorter.enabledLanguages.description: Which built-in languages to enable. Empty array = all built-in languages. Available: ruby, erb, html, javascriptreact, typescriptreact, vue.

tailwindcss-sorter.customLanguages.description: Custom language patterns. Use to add new languages or override built-in patterns.

regex.description: Regular expression to match class attributes

captureGroup.description: The capture group index containing the class string

tailwindcss-sorter.runOnSave.description: Automatically sort Tailwind classes when saving a file. Note: This is disabled by default to avoid conflicts with other formatters. Consider using the command or code actions instead.

tailwindcss-sorter.showCodeActions.description: Show 'Sort Tailwind Classes' as a code action (quick fix) when the cursor is on a class attribute.

tailwindcss-sorter.showDiagnostics.description: Show diagnostic hints when classes are not sorted. Disabled by default to be non-intrusive.

tailwindcss-sorter.diagnosticSeverity.description: Severity level for unsorted class diagnostics.

scripts.compile: npm run check-types && npm run lint && node esbuild.js
scripts.package: npm run check-types && npm run lint && node esbuild.js --production
scripts.pretest: npm run compile-tests && npm run compile && npm run lint
